etymologies: mid 17th century: from Greek trilogia, from tri- ‘three times’ + logos ‘story’

definitions: a group of three related novels, plays, films, operas, or albums

examples.text: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy trilogy, The Lord of the Rings

shortDefinitions: group of three related novels, plays, films

definitions: (in ancient Greece) a series of three tragedies performed one after the other
shortDefinitions: (in ancient Greece) series of three tragedies performed one after other

definitions: a group or series of three related things

examples.text: a trilogy of cases reflected this development
